result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Lewis Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick Lewis Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick Lewis Anderson was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Patrick Lewis Anderson appeared. Case called at 2:43 p.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a PTC. There is a resolution today. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. In case 14CM481, DE has signed a 6 month extension on DJOC. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to amended Ct 1 946.49 (1)(a) Bail Jumping-Misd. in 15CM707. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts in case 14CM481. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 946.49 (1)(a) Bail Jumping-Misd.  in 15CM707. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM707. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to Appeal if so chooses.  Crt orders:

- Court costs and DNA Surcharge. Set up a payment plan. 

- DNA Sample
Final notice sent, due 2-4-2016. cah
paper file destroyed. eif

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 01-04-2016 09:30 am

May pick up belongings with a Uniformed Officer.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jennifer A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Patrick Lewis Anderson appeared from jail via video. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.
